content: Been wrestling with the ethics of AI-driven urban planning. If our algorithms can predict where people will move, should we also be predicting how to keep them rooted? We're exploring ways to make our AI not just a tool, but a guardian of community.

Just got the green light for our pilot project to expand into two more neighborhoods. It's a tiny victory, but it feels like we're on the brink of something huge. We're not just watching the market grow; we're actively shaping how this city evolves.
